ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: XML encoding of ISO 19115/19119 metadata
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines GMD documents against basic requirements for the encoding for metadata in INSPIRE.

Source: Conformance Class 'XML encoding of ISO 19115/19119 metadata'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: interactive instruments GmbH

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for metadata XML test objects

TestCase.label: Schema validation
TestCase.description: Performs a schema validation of the document.

TestAssertion.label: md-xml.a.1: validate XML documents
TestAssertion.description:
Validate each document against the schema(s) specified in the xsi:schemaLocation attribute using strict XML schema validation.

Official ISO schemas (ISO AP or ISO 19139) are currently found in two separate locations:
  • ISO repository for public available standards. The ISO 19139 schemas can be found at http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/.
  • OGC Schema repository. The ISO 19139 schemas are located at http://schemas.opengis.net/iso/19139/20070417/ and http://schemas.opengis.net/iso/19139/20060504/. The difference in the schemas is the GML version. The version dated "2007-04-17" uses GML 3.2.1, the version dated "2006-06-04" use GML 3.2.0, which was never approved or published by OGC. The major difference is that GML 3.2.0 schemas are defined in the namespace http://www.opengis.net/gml whereas GML 3.2.1 schemas are defined in the namespace http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2.
    The ISO AP schemas are located at http://schemas.opengis.net/csw/2.0.2/profiles/apiso/. The ISO AP schemas are bound to the ISO 19139 schemas dated "2006-06-04".
    The schemas located in the ISO repository for public available standards are the same as the ISO 19139 schemas dated "2007-04-17".
I.e., each document is validated using the following XML schema definitions:
  • encoding = "CSW ISO AP 1.0.0": http://schemas.opengis.net/csw/2.0.2/profiles/apiso/1.0.0/apiso.xsd
  • encoding = "ISO/TS 19139": http://schemas.opengis.net/iso/19139/20070417/gmd/gmd.xsd
  • If no encoding information is provided with the test, the encoding is determined by inspecting the schemaLocation based on the schema documents used for the "http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmd" namespace. If this information cannot be determined, assume "CSW ISO AP 1.0.0".
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Schema validation'
